item.title: Report X-2024050845
item.description:
Report X-2024050845

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-22T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained nine glass bottles and one of broke spill it's contents inside of the box. Three of the bottles were wrapped with absorbent material and inside of barrier bags the rest were separated by fiberboard dividers. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024050353
item.description:
Report E-2024050353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 10 gallons of material impacting the trailer floor and concrete dock released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum that was punctured by a nail. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbent's to the impacted areas and cleaned the impacted areas and containerized the damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum and the recovered impacted absorbents were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024050745
item.description:
Report X-2024050745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained eight glass bottles packaged in plastic bags and vermiculite. One of the bottles broke spill the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed int a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for a new declaration for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024040462
item.description:
Report E-2024040462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 15th, 2024, at 11:47 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard in Nashville, Tennessee, reported GATX65584, a residue tank car of Sulfur, molten, was suspected to be leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, PCS Sales, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #20240408-00072). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a vapor release due to a hole in the tank shell nozzle. MEI personnel cleaned and purged the tank car to remove all hazardous residue. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Matt Paynter, Matt.paynter@nutrien.com, 706-564-8118). It was subsequently determined that repair costs exceeded car value; tank car will be cut for scrap on location.
